doc:
The object is a helper object to manage the selection for a widget. The object is automatically created when a new widget is created, and cannot exist independently of this widget. The primary reason the objects exists is for cleanliness of code and API. That is, there is no conceptual reason all these functions could not be methods on the widget instead of a separate function.

The object is gotten from a by calling . It can be manipulated to check the selection status of the tree, as well as select and deselect individual rows. Selection is done completely view side. As a result, multiple views of the same model can have completely different selections. Additionally, you cannot change the selection of a row on the model that is not currently displayed by the view without expanding its parents first.

One of the important things to remember when monitoring the selection of a view is that the signal is mostly a hint. That is, it may only emit one signal when a range of rows is selected. Additionally, it may on occasion emit a signal when nothing has happened (mostly as a result of programmers calling select_row on an already selected row).

methods.doc: Returns the number of rows that have been selected in @tree.
methods.name: count_selected_rows

methods.doc: Gets the selection mode for selection. See .
methods.name: get_mode

methods.doc: Returns the current selection function.
methods.name: get_select_function

methods.doc:
Sets iter to the currently selected node if selection is set to

GTK_SELECTION_SINGLE or #GTK_SELECTION_BROWSE. iter may be NULL if you

just want to test if selection has any selected nodes. model is filled with the current model as a convenience. This function will not work if you use selection is #GTK_SELECTION_MULTIPLE.
methods.name: get_selected

methods.doc:
Creates a list of path of all selected rows. Additionally, if you are planning on modifying the model after calling this function, you may want to convert the returned list into a list of #GtkTreeRowReferences. To do this, you can use .

To free the return value, use: |[<!-- language="C" --> g_list_free_full (list, (GDestroyNotify) gtk_tree_path_free); ]|
methods.name: get_selected_rows

methods.doc: Returns the tree view associated with selection.
methods.name: get_tree_view

methods.doc: Returns the user data for the selection function.
methods.name: get_user_data

methods.doc: Returns true if the row at iter is currently selected.
methods.name: iter_is_selected

methods.doc: Returns true if the row pointed to by path is currently selected. If path does not point to a valid location, false is returned
methods.name: path_is_selected

methods.doc: Selects all the nodes. selection must be set to #GTK_SELECTION_MULTIPLE mode.
methods.name: select_all

methods.doc: Selects the specified iterator.
methods.name: select_iter

methods.doc: Select the row at path.
methods.name: select_path

methods.doc: Selects a range of nodes, determined by start_path and end_path inclusive. selection must be set to #GTK_SELECTION_MULTIPLE mode.
methods.name: select_range

methods.doc: Calls a function for each selected node. Note that you cannot modify the tree or selection from within this function. As a result, might be more useful.
methods.name: selected_foreach

methods.doc:
Sets the selection mode of the selection. If the previous type was

GTK_SELECTION_MULTIPLE, then the anchor is kept selected, if it was

previously selected.
methods.name: set_mode

methods.doc:
Sets the selection function.

If set, this function is called before any node is selected or unselected, giving some control over which nodes are selected. The select function should return true if the state of the node may be toggled, and false if the state of the node should be left unchanged.
methods.name: set_select_function

methods.doc: Unselects all the nodes.
methods.name: unselect_all

methods.doc: Unselects the specified iterator.
methods.name: unselect_iter

methods.doc: Unselects the row at path.
methods.name: unselect_path

methods.doc: Unselects a range of nodes, determined by start_path and end_path inclusive.
methods.name: unselect_range

name: TreeSelection

properties.doc: Selection mode. See for more information on this property.
properties.name: mode

signals.doc: Emitted whenever the selection has (possibly) changed. Please note that this signal is mostly a hint. It may only be emitted once when a range of rows are selected, and it may occasionally be emitted when nothing has happened.
signals.name: changed
